intro: Ebermaiera obtusa, commonly known as the broad-leaved evergreen, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, elliptical leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. It produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is often found in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
